body_html:
For TF, the code you have is suboptimal. Modifying the following should help:

Replace:
X_tf = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(None, n_feature), name="X")
with:
X_tf = tf.Variable(X)

And change the next cell to:

with tf.Session() as sess:
init.run()
out.eval() # Certain optimization passes are run on the first eval for a new graph
%timeit out.eval()
body_text:
For TF, the code you have is suboptimal. Modifying the following should help:
Replace:
X_tf = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(None, n_feature), name="X")
with:
X_tf = tf.Variable(X)
And change the next cell to:
with tf.Session() as sess:
init.run()
out.eval()  # Certain optimization passes are run on the first eval for a new graph
%timeit out.eval()
body:
For TF, the code you have is suboptimal. Modifying the following should help:

Replace:
X_tf = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=(None, n_feature), name="X")
with:
X_tf = tf.Variable(X)

And change the next cell to:

with tf.Session() as sess:
    init.run()
    out.eval()  # Certain optimization passes are run on the first eval for a new graph
    %timeit out.eval()
